content.p: A Department of Transportation report about air travel found that, nationwide, 78% of all flights are on time. Suppose a random sample of 50 flights is selected from all nationwide flights that were completed in the past 30 days (over 1000 flights). Let the random variable X be defined as the number of sampled flights that arrived on time.

body.p: What is the value of the n parameter of the binomial random variable X?

response.feedback: Incorrect. This is the probability that the flight is on time.
Correct. X is a binomial random variable resulting from an experiment of 50 independent trials (n), in this case the number of flights sampled.
Incorrect. This is 78% of the number of flights sampled. The n parameter is the number of trials in the experiment.
Incorrect. This is the number of days over which a flight was completed. The n parameter is the number of trials in the experiment.

part.hint: Recall a binomial random variable has two parameters, n and p, where n is the fixed number of trials.

body.p: What is the value of the p parameter of the binomial random variable X?

response.feedback: Correct. X is a binomial random variable with a probability of “success” (p) = “flight on‑time” = 0.78.
Incorrect. This is the probability of “failure” (1 ‑ p = “flight not on‑time.”
Incorrect. This is the sample divided by the total number of flights.

part.hint: Recall a binomial random variable has two parameters, n and p, where p is the probability of “success”.
